utterance.speaker: RENZO
utterance.content: Long flight?

utterance.speaker: MATHIAS
utterance.content: Endless. How much further.

utterance.speaker: RENZO
utterance.content: You have some time. If you want to sleep, go ahead, sir.

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey! Made some coffee for you. It’s insomniac strength. This is the fourth night in a row that you haven’t slept. Something wrong?

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know. Maybe my subconscious has a pressing need to catch up on my Facebook likes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Martha. Good morning.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Good morning, darling.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Would you like some breakfast?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: No, thank you. I’m fasting for clarity. I’ve been asked to read for the new Stoppard play.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So what’s the problem?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, I haven’t auditioned for anything in ages. I think I need to decide if that particular train has left the station.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: “Ms. Katherine Beckett”? What’s this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, an ex is getting married. Do you remember Will Sorenson?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Your old FBI squeeze?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh man. You’re so lucky I came along and saved you from that life.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, you saved me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Come on. Even you have to admit he was boring. Like, C-Span boring.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, what makes you think that I would be with Sorenson if you hadn’t come along?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right. Where would you be?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If you weren’t around to distract me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um… I would probably be captain of my own precinct.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. Had I not been bewitched by you I think by now I’d be working on my second Pulitzer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So we’re bad for each other, huh?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The worst.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Guess we’d both be better off if we’d never met.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s like It’s A Wonderful Life. Every time your phone rings a victim gets their wings.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: His name is Mathias Gensler. His passport indicates that he is a Swiss national. Witnesses said that two masked men attacked both driver and Gensler before cutting a silver briefcase handcuffed to Mr. Gensler’s wrist.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So this was an ambush. Whoever did this knew that he had that case with him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Looks like the attackers fled in a late model G-Wagon, no plates.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is that a boot print on his shirt?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The killer must have held him down with his foot.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So what was in the case? Nuclear launch codes? Deadly virus?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We don’t know yet. The driver’s log shows that Mr. Gensler was picked up at Teterboro Airport after arriving on a private charter flight from Switzerland.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And where was the car taking him?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The manifest only lists the pickup.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You call the car company?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh … there’s no one to call. The driver, Renzo Conrad, owned the service. He was a one man band.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Speaking of one man band, where’s your partner?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. And Lanie?

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: Wait! Wait!

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’re here. We were just, uh …

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Stuck in traffic.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why don’t you bring Romeo here up to speed and contact the Swiss consulate. Maybe they know what Gensler was up to.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Castle, what are you doing with my body?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Just pretend that you don’t know him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett, this is not dirt. It’s flinty. Hints of carbon. It’s coal. Pulverized, unrefined coal.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So I used a clue like this in one of my early Derrick Storm books. It’s very unusual to find unrefined coal outside a coal-fired power plant.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All the coal plants in the city are either shut down or converted.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right, but some of them are still standing. There’s an abandoned one on Hudson they’re going to turn into a shopping mall.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Coal dust could have come from a lot of places.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: An abandoned plant would be a perfect place to launch a strike like this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lanie, why don’t you get CSU techs to test the substance on the victim’s shirt. We’ve got to go to Teterboro and look into that flight.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And that coal plant is right on the way.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Fine. We’ll stop off at the coal plant.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you thinking about going?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Going where?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sorenson’s wedding. Take a little trip down memory lane?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t think that’s such a good idea.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m not really ready for someone else’s perfect day.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know I’d give anything to change what happened, right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I know you would.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle. You were right. The shooter’s G-Wagon is here. Espo, hey. I need backup at the Hudson River coal plant.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s the case.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’s in it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Some kind of artifact.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Must be valuable if it was worth killing over.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, what are you –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Get down!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why do you always have to touch everything?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I thought you liked that about me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Move!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett? Beckett?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Guys! Hey, guys! Beckett’s in trouble. I got away, but her car is missing. I think she was abducted.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh … Captain?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re okay! You made it back.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Captain Beckett, this guy claims you’re in trouble.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Captain?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You know him?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ve never seen this man before in my life.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Never seen me before? Okay. That’s … very funny. I’m just glad you’re okay. How did you get back here?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Excuse me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: From the power plant. We were being shot at. That’s a nice suit, but the way.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Whoever you are, I think you better leave.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoever I am?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Come on, pal. Whatever trip you’re on, if you leave quietly I’m sure we can forget this ever happened.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, oh. I get it. You guys are punking me. Sorry. Just like, uh … my birthday. This is good! How did you stage that? A double shooting, the severed hand, coal dust on his shirt?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He just described our crime scene.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where did you get that information?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: From being at the crime scene with all of you.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Captain, we only got the forensics about the coal dust five minutes ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And how do you know so much about this case?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Kate, okay, you know what? You got me. Joke’s over.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re right. It is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Guys, seriously. What’s going on here?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mr. Richard Castle. Huh. You’re a novelist. Why don’t you tell us a story about where you were between 4 and 6AM?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: In bed with Beckett.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe you shouldn’t talk about the Captain like that.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: How did you know about that coal dust?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, that’s where all this started. At the plant. There was – – there was an explosion. I must have gotten knocked out. This is a dream. Okay? You guys are just creations of psyche. This is me just working out some issues. That’s why you don’t know me. Because you aren’t real. And you know what? I can prove it. Well known fact: it’s impossible to read in a dream.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: “Richard Castle, AKA Richard Rodgers.”

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You had me worried there. For a second there I thought I didn’t exist.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa. It says here I jumped on a Macy’s parade float and sang “Let It Go” with Idina Menzel and then landed a hot air balloon naked in Central Park? I didn’t do these things, guys. Come on. I would never sing “Let It Go” as a duet.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mr. Castle. This is going to go much easier for you if you just tell us what you know about those murders.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, Kate? Kate?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: This guy’s nuts.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Come on. Please, just talk to me.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Sit down or I’ll have to restrain you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know you’re in there, because usually I’m right beside you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Castle. Sit down.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ll handle this.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You sure, Captain?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Castle, let’s just say for a moment that you and I did meet each other. Where would that have been?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: At my book party. You came to me. You asked me to consult on a copycat murder. It was six years ago. Your hair was short then. It was adorable.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Six years ago, huh? Well, it says here that you met with a Detective McNulty. Apparently you helped him solve the case.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: McNulty? No, no, no. Kate, it was you. Okay? I woke up next to you this morning. I’m not imagining that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I - I’m sorry, Mr. Castle. We don’t have a relationship. Before today, you and I have never met. Now, is there someone that you would like to call?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Who should I make this out to?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ah, Kevin, Mrs. Rodgers.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ah ha. All right. Kevin.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Your Mama Rose in Gypsy? Perfection.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, thank you. You are a dear sweet boy.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You were robbed of that third Tony.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, well.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mother?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Richard! Darling, you look like hell.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank God. You know me.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: No, no, no. Please. Darling, you’re filthy.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You’re lucky your mommy could alibi you out for the murder.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: He only kills on paper.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: And I’ll have you know that coming down to the police station to get my grown son out of prison is the last thing I have time for. You know full well we open in two days.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We open what?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Mame.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mame.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: My revival of Auntie Mame. Exactly how hard did you party last night?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Apparently very, very hard. Oh, that can’t be good.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Come on, kiddo. Come on.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, dear.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Don’t worry, darling. Once you’re home you’ll feel much better.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh my God, Mother. What have you done with my place?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, Richard. We have talked about this. Now that we share the mortgage, it is our place. And since you have lost most of your life savings –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa. Wha – lost my savings? How?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: You invested poorly. Mostly blondes and racehorses. And it’s not as if your great American novel here is flying off the shelves.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Finite Laughter? I did not write this. This … “Babcock was a small man. A small man with large dreams and one of those dreams was Betty.” This is awful!

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Exactly what the critics said. But I am pleased to see that distance has given you some perspective. Good.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, hey Dad.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I see you made bail.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Alexis, your hair. When did you do that?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Uh … three years ago? Before I moved to LA.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: LA?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Richard, don’t start. Alexis is here for a few days. She’s taking time off from saving the world to come to my opening night.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. Okay, that’s it. That’s it. I’m done.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Gram, is he okay?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: He had a rough night.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whatever all of this is? A coma, a dream, some weird hallucination, or even just an undigested bit of pizza? I’m ending it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s time to wake up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t understand. I’ve never had a dream like this before. Why am I not waking up?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Maybe it’s not a dream. Maybe you traveled into some sort of alternate universe.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, Alexis. Don’t tease your father. Darling, maybe you just better lie down.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, maybe I should.

utterance.speaker: CHELSEA
utterance.content: Hey Richie. I used your hidden key, like you said.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who are you?

utterance.speaker: CHELSEA
utterance.content: Oh, is that what we’re playing? Okay. I saw you at the bus stop, mister, and I followed you home.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, obviously we know each other. Chelsea?

utterance.speaker: CHELSEA
utterance.content: Oh, it was the funnest two weeks of my life.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. Oh - really – I really can’t do this.

utterance.speaker: CHELSEA
utterance.content: Sure you can. Sure you can. I’ve got a couple of little blue pills in my purse.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh – no – no, I mean – no, I just - I – have to get back to work. Look, you seem like a – a lovely … young – young woman. But I – I – think you should go.

utterance.speaker: CHELSEA
utterance.content: Seriously? Writers are so strange.

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: It was like suddenly I walked through a doorway where I knew everyone but everyone was different. My wife was married to another man.

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: I came back home and my parents didn’t recognize me. They didn’t know me.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, good morning darling. Are you feeling better today?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Much. Because I know what’s going on. I know why I’m here. It’s this.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: “Swiss archaeological team discovers ancient Incan artifact.”

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not just any artifact. Given its markings, some mystics believe that it’s connected to the Incan gateway to the gods. A doorway through which shamans were known to travel into other realms.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, I was joking. Please don’t tell me you believe this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Alexis, I was holding this. And right at that moment the grenade was rolling between us … I was thinking maybe I wasn’t good for her. Maybe Beckett would be happier if we had never met. That’s what changed. That’s where I am. In a world where we never met. It’s like the last six years didn’t happen.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Who – who’s Beckett?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Exactly. You don’t know who she is because she and I never met, so I didn’t write Nikki Heat. I wrote that God awful piece of trash instead. And with less money coming in you were forced to go out and be successful.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: I found success because of my boundless talent.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And somehow we drifted apart.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Somehow?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m not crazy. This is not my world. I need to get back home.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: How do you intend to do that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: By helping this world’s Beckett find that artifact. So I can get back to my reality.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: This is why I live with Mom.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you’re a fan. And here I thought you didn’t know me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t. I mean, I didn’t. I – I –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Didn’t recognize me in my deranged state? Listen. I have to apologize. How I acted, you must have thought I was crazy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, yeah, that’s because you were.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. It’s this new book I’ve been working on. I have been working nonstop. I mean, I have been drinking coffee, popping No-Doz. I haven’t slept in days. And to make matters worse, the new character, I kind of based her on you. What I’ve read about you. So she’s savvy and smart and driven and I have fallen in love with her. I eat with her, I sleep with her. But I know you are not her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, none of this explains how you know so much about the crime scene.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I have a police scanner and I was tracking the investigation. Actually, that’s why I’m here, Captain. I know what was in the briefcase. I know where it’s going and I think I know who took it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And how do you know all that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s complicated. But I do.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey Cap. What’s he doing here?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m not sure.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay. So uh … heard back from the courier company. Turns out our victim was transporting –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: - an ancient Incan artifact.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. And it was on its way -

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: To the Lamont-Doherty Laboratory in Palisades, New York. For studies. Scientists believe it was fashioned from meteorite, but it’s proven impenetrable to conventional scans. How did I know all this? I used to be a crime novelist and I still have a few sources. Captain, this is what your victims were killed for.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And why would someone kill for this?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, the folks at the lab said that an object like that would be invaluable to any collector.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Castle, you said that you might know who took it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not exactly who, but I know who was involved.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So the car service was going to pick up Gensler, the courier, from the airport here, take him to the lab, here. Basically north. But for some reason, when they were attacked they ended up here, in Spanish Harlem.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The opposite way.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. So either this driver has a terrible sense of direction –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: - or he was in on it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And maybe his partners killed him to silence him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Detective Ryan, get everything you can on that driver.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That was surprisingly helpful, Mr. Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do you mind if I hang around? See how this turns out?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh uh. Break room’s over there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. Writer boy. Tell me how you know about that coal plant.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The one you were talking about when you came in yesterday. Captain had me check it out. You know what I found?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Tire tracks. The same tire tracks we found at our crime scene. Now, you knew that our doers were using it as a staging ground. The only way you would know that is if you were involved.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, fine. I don’t usually like to tell people this, but I have a gift. I know things.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You know things?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You and I haven’t met before yesterday, correct?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So then how would I know that you had a thing with a woman whose initials were … L.P. And how would I know that she moved on and you can’t.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ryan has a big fat mouth. That’s how you know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What happened? Commitment issues?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey man, we’ve got something.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay, so over the last four days before he was killed our driver made a –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Our driver made a series of phone calls to a pay phone located inside of a restaurant. The only problem is the place has been shut down the last couple months.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Who was he calling?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I have no idea, but check it out. This deserted restaurant, El Chozo? Maybe that’s where he was headed. It’s right near where the SUV was attacked.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right. Get up there. See what you can find.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, Captain? Would it be possible for me to ride along? Strictly for research purposes.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Is he kidding?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I would just love the chance to observe. Get some details for my book.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, sure, Cap. We’ll take him along.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What the …

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Dude, it’s Martha Rodger’s son. He can get us house seats. You can get us house seats, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ab … solutely.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. But do as they say and don’t interfere.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Come on. Let’s go, house seats.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So the Captain, is she seeing anyone?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: She has boyfriends. Nothing serious.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Why, writer boy? What, you think you have a chance with her? And what are you doing? Telling crazy over here about everyone’s private life.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Me?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. You told him about Lanie and me.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No. No, no, no. I didn’t.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. Listen, I have a gift, all right? I look at people and I see things.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah? Uh … what do you see when you look at me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Honey milk and freckles.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No! That’s Jenny O’Malley. She used to … make me honey milk. She could’ve been the one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Could’ve?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. Um … when Beckett was promoted to Captain our case load doubled. I guess I never had time for her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe you should give her a call.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe you should mind your own business.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right. Here are the rules. Stay in the car or I shoot you. Got it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You want to crack a window for me?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I can’t believe the Captain’s making us babysit this nutjob.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, he’s not so bad.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. Take me home.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Come on.

utterance.speaker: MARIA SANCHEZ
utterance.content: Hand it over. Or you die.

utterance.speaker: MARIA
utterance.content: Who sent you? What do you know?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nobody sent me. Nobody – uh, just – it sent me. The object. It sent me. I saw a blue light and I ended up here.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: NYPD! Drop your knife, now!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What the hell, man? You were supposed to wait in the car.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What does it matter now? It’s broken! Now I’m never getting home. I’m stuck here in this life. But the real one would never break. This is a fake! This is a fake. Where did you get this and where’s the real one?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Cuff him, too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What the hell do you think you were doing? You could have gotten yourself killed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I had backup. And I did help capture a suspect.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, you were supposed to accompany and observe, not participate and –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Annoy!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Risk my people’s lives. Now, after this morning’s antics I expected you to be on your best behavior.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Actually, that kind of is my best behavior.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, I’m just enjoying the show. Our suspect’s name is Maria Sanchez. She’s wanted by the Peruvian government in connection with the bombings at a government building. Not to mention the theft and trafficking of stolen artifacts.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then that’s her. She’s behind it. And we need to talk to her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, Mr. Castle. They need to talk to her. You need to go home. You’re done with this case.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re lucky I don’t arrest you for obstruction. Officer, please escort Mr. Castle to the elevator.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You don’t understand. I need to find this artifact. Beckett! Please.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, Detective Esposito?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You’re not letting him get to you, are you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don’t you have a case to close?

utterance.speaker: MARIA
utterance.content: You call it smuggling. We call it taking back our rightful legacy. That artifact was considered divine by our shamans and belongs to the Incan people.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Was that legacy worth the lives of two men?

utterance.speaker: MARIA
utterance.content: No, that wasn’t the plan.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, what was the plan, Maria?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Come on, just ask her where the artifact is.

utterance.speaker: MARIA
utterance.content: My cousin, Renzo, he was the driver. He put sedatives in the courier’s water. To knock him out. Once Gensler was asleep we were going to bring him to the restaurant and switch the cases. No one was supposed to get hurt. But someone attacked them. Someone else took it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You don’t know where it is?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That attack happened just a few blocks from the restaurant. How did they know the car was going to be there? Who else was involved, Maria? Who else besides you and Renzo knew about the change in route?

utterance.speaker: MARIA
utterance.content: No one.

utterance.speaker: MARIA
utterance.content: Except the guy at the airport.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What guy?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What guy?

utterance.speaker: MARIA
utterance.content: The plan only worked if Renzo made the pickup, but the courier, Gensler, was using another car service. So we paid the concierge at the private jet terminal to change limo companies. Maybe he told someone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well maybe he knows where the artifact is. Just … ask her his name.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Do you remember his name?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Castle!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. I was – I just … um…

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I can’t believe she locked me up. She had no idea she’s stopping me from getting back to her.

utterance.speaker: PERP
utterance.content: I don’t know, man. Maybe this is your real life. Because the one where you’re rich and famous and engaged to the hot cop? Sounds pretty made up to me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I called your mother. She refused to come and get you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. Well, she always did believe in tough love.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That doesn’t seem to have worked out in your case.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What is it with you and this case, Mr. Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m a mystery writer. I’m compelled to know how the story ends.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: With you. Going home.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re letting me go?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I could let you stay overnight but then I would have to do the paperwork.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, no, no.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, you were right. We have met before.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We have?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: On a book tour for an old Derrick Storm novel. I, uh, waited in line to get it signed. By you. I used to love those books.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You never told me that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, we’ve only known each other for a day. Although it feels a lot longer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I have that effect on people.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There’s something I’ve been meaning to ask you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Anything.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why did you kill off Derrick Storm?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey Captain. We’ve got something.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Another time, I guess. Good night, Mr. Castle.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So we talked to the concierge at the airport. He admitted to taking a bribe from Maria to switch limo companies, but he swore that he didn’t tell anyone.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: But when we held his feet to the fire he came clean about what he saw that night.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: A black G-wagon sitting outside the airport gates with two guys in it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Our shooters. So they must have been waiting for Gensler and then they followed him from the airport.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, and while they were waiting one of them slipped out for a smoke. Surveillance caught him on camera.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We issued a BOLO and we’re going to run the tattoo through the database in the morning.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right. Why don’t you gentlemen keep me apprised?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I thought we agreed that you were leaving.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I had a thought about the case –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re not on the case.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Actually, I was thinking about you. I was wondering if I could buy you a drink. It’s the least I could do. I owe you that much.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Right, well, I don’t think that that would be a good –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And … if you come I will tell you why I killed Derrick Storm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, youngest woman to ever make captain. That’s impressive.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s not all that it’s cracked up to be.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, and if you really are basing a character on me then she’s going to be boring.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, I doubt you could ever be boring.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, my life mostly consists of paperwork and politics.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, you miss the streets.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um … … truthfully, I don’t think I was meant to be a homicide detective.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why would you say that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because. The case that made me want to become a cop I was never able to solve.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anyway, back to you. Why did you kill of Derrick Storm?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah. It’s complicated.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait. What is this place? I thought this was a date.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, hang on. Hear me out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re still working the case.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Listen, the crimson rhino is the mascot for an Australian rugby team. If our suspect has it tattooed on his neck he’s got to be a major fan. I looked it up. There’s only one bar in New York that plays their games live. And there’s one on right now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I knew this was a mistake.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett, wait.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s him. Stay here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Excuse me. NYPD. Step away from the bar and put your hands where I can see them.

utterance.speaker: TATTOOED MAN
utterance.content: Sure thing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We make a pretty good team, you and I.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well? What’d he say?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nothing, on the advice of his high-powered council.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. So what’s our next move.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There is no next move. You asked to stick around until this case was resolved. It’s resolved.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How is it resolved?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Detectives Ryan and Esposito found the G-wagon and the murder weapons at our suspect’s place. This is open and shut.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about the artifact? We need to find it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Whoever had them steal it, it and they are long gone by now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Someone has to know where it is. There’s the other shooter.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, but we have no way to find him. Look, the DA’s going to ask for a plea deal. But trust me. This suspect’s ex-military. He’s not going to roll.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So that’s it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This isn’t one of your books, Mr. Castle. You don’t always get the answers. We cleared the case. It’s a win.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. You know, that can’t be it. The Kate Beckett in my world would never call this a win. The Kate Beckett where I come from? She would be unrelenting in the face of anything that is thrown in her path. She would find the truth and she would never compromise.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know what twilight zone world you think you come from, but you don’t know me. And don’t pretend you do. Good bye, Mr. Castle. We’re done here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. You’re still up.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Still on LA time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: So did you find your mystic meteor?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, no. Um … trail went cold.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Guess you’re stuck here with us, then.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Come – come sit with me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Come on. Just give me a chance. Just … um … for old time’s sake. I have a question for you. And I would love a non-ironic answer. What happened to us? Why did you move to LA?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You know why.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Tell me again.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Because you gave up. You read all those terrible reviews on your magnum opus and you couldn’t move past it, and I couldn’t stick around and watch. But you know what? Now I think I understand it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I had all these plans, you know? To change the world. But this non-profit I’m working for, everything we do seems so small and pointless. It’s like nothing I do matters, so why try?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sweetie, no. Everything you do matters. Every moment, every decision that you make, it affects the people around you. It changes the world in a million imperceptible ways. And no matter what your reality, you can make it better. We both can.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I’ve missed you, Dad.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: La la la la la la la la, le le le le le, low, low, low. Oh, darling! Where are you off to?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m going to take my own advice. I know why the universe sent me to this world. So the most important day of our lives got screw up. Big deal. She’s better off with me and I’m better off with her. Even in this world. If I can prove to this Beckett how extraordinary she is, she can help me find that artifact. And I can get back home.

utterance.speaker: CASHIER
utterance.content: There you go. That’s a large cappuccino for Rick and a large skinny latte, two pumps sugar free vanilla for Kate, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Perfect. Thank you very much.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Taxi!

utterance.speaker: JACK
utterance.content: That’s okay. I’ll give you a ride.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I hate this world.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. Take it easy.

utterance.speaker: LAWYER
utterance.content: That’s him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Marcus Lark. Lark Development. So you’re behind this.

utterance.speaker: MARCUS LARK
utterance.content: What do you know about this, Mr. Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know you killed two men for it.

utterance.speaker: LARK
utterance.content: Oh, you know more than that. My attorney overheard you at the police station. So I had him check up on you. Pretty strange behavior the last two days, which either means you’re psychotic or this isn’t your world.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I have no idea what you’re talking about.

utterance.speaker: LARK
utterance.content: I think you do.

utterance.speaker: LARK
utterance.content: Do you know how many years I spent looking for this? Hearing the whispered secrets? Ancient alien technology. Naturally occurring quantum anomalies. I spent years untangling legend from truth. The Incans believed it was a gateway to the gods, but it’s not. It’s a doorway to the infinite. A chance to change my destiny. I know everything about this, Mr. Castle. Except how it works.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re rich. Successful. You have everything. Why would you want to change your destiny?

utterance.speaker: LARK
utterance.content: No man lives without regrets. Now then, Mr. Castle. How does it work?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know. I was holding on to it and it just happened.

utterance.speaker: LARK
utterance.content: Look, I don’t want to hurt you. But I will if you don’t tell me how it works.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I swear to you, I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: LARK
utterance.content: Shoot out his knee.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: NYPD! Drop your weapon, now!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Regret this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. How’d you find me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I couldn’t stop thinking about what you said, about compromise. So I decided to retrace the investigation. It’s just pure luck that it brought me here when it did.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or fate.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why are you here? What did they want from you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Something I guess I didn’t have.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look out!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, God. Mr. Castle. You saved my life. Why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because I love you, Kate.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Castle. No, please don’t go. Stay with me. Stay with me. Castle. Castle? Castle.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle? Castle.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle? Castle. Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s you. My you!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m back. I’m back. And I’m not dead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What happened? You hit your head?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. How long was I gone?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know. We got separated. Ryan and Esposito got here just in time with backup.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, Castle. Missed all the excitement. We were awesome. Weren’t we, Javi?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: As usual.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Lark.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It looks like he was behind the theft, although none of them are talking. You know, the one thing that we haven’t been able to find is the object that was in the briefcase.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: When you hold this do not wonder, even for a second, if you’d be better off any place else but here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So in this alternate universe, I was the Captain and you and I had never met?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You were married to your work. A lot like you were when I met you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And how were you without me? Did you win the Pulitzer?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh … … I was still waiting to hear. But I – my life was nowhere near as wonderful without you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s quite a dream. Magical artifacts and parallel worlds.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, it was a lot more than that. You know, the only other world I would want to visit is the one where I made it to our wedding.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Me too.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know. It’s the reason I haven’t been sleeping. You know, I keep trying to figure it out. How do you live with the man who’s lost two months of his life and left you at the altar? How do I live with the pain I know I’ve caused you? How do we get past this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I wish I knew.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think I have the answer. We just - do. So … Katherine Beckett, will you marry me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ve already said yes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Will you marry me, right now?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. Thank you for coming on such short notice.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, darling. I am so proud of you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mother, you know that audition?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I really think you should go for it.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: All right. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
